channel.title: Portfolios on R-Ladies explore Dear Data
channel.description: Recent content in Portfolios on R-Ladies explore Dear Data

item.title: Join us and show us your data!
item.description: Do you would like to join us? Here we summarised all required information about the prohect including a few tips how to get started.

item.title: Getting started
item.description: A short guide describing a possible workflow how to get started with data acquisition and turning data into a beautiful post card.

item.title: The Dear Data project
item.description:
Dear Data is a collection post cards visualizing daily routines drawn by Georiga Lupi and Stefanie Posavec Link.

Each week both crafted and sent each other post card crossing the ocean to stay in contact. Each card shows the data of a distinct topic based on their own habbits and daily life.

item.title: Name of the work 5
item.description: Fifth abundantly made Give sixth hath. Cattle creature i be don’t them.

item.title: Dear Data in detail
item.description: Few more information about the postcard journey of Georgia and Stefanie.

item.title: Agenda for first chat
item.description: Things that are in our mind that we would like to implement before the release of this project.

item.title: Item with image
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.

item.title: Item with image
item.description: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth.

item.title: Name of the work 1
item.description: Even the all-powerful Pointing has no control about the blind texts it is an almost unorthographic life. One day however a small line of blind text by the name of Lorem Ipsum decided to leave for the far World of Grammar.
